Pengangguran di Banten Tertinggi se-RI, DPRD: Kaget Juga!
05 Nov 2019, 11:03 by Bahtiar Rifa'i


Ilustrasi pencari kerja/Foto: Puti Aini Yasmin

Serang - Ketua Komisi V DPRD Banten Muhammad Nizar mengatakan terjadi paradoks terkait angka pengangguran tertinggi di wilayahnya sebesar 8,11%. Padahal, di Banten terdapat kurang lebih 16 ribu industri mulai dari Tangerang sampai Serang. "Ini buat kami paradoks karena angka jumlah industri sektor formal hampir 16 ribu. Jadi ada sesuatu yang salah," kata Nizar saat berbincang dengan detikcom di Serang, Banten, Selasa (5/11/2019). Padahal 2 minggu lalu Komisi V sudah melakukan rapat dengar pendapat dengan Disnaker (Dinas Ketenagakerjaan) Banten. DPRD mendapat laporan ada penurunan angka pengangguran dan Banten ada di urutan ke-5."Kaget juga mendengar angka terbesar 8,11%," ujarnya. Atas persoalan ini, pihaknya akan memanggil Disnaker beserta UPT Disnaker di daerah. Karena, ada tugas UPT yang mengawasi di masing-masing industri. Pemanggilan lanjutnya sekaligus meminta penjelasan apakah pekerja yang ada di industri Banten tidak dapat menyerap pemuda daerah. Termasuk apakah terjadi percaloan di industri yang selama ini sering didengar oleh publik. "UPT pengawasan jangan-jangan hanya soal administrasi saja, kalau fungsi pengawasan di industri berjalan, saya kira calo tidak akan ada," tambahnya. Terakhir, Nizar menjelaskan bahwa perlu ada koordinasi antara Disnaker dan Dinas Pendidikan khususnya untuk penempatan lulusan SMK. Apalagi, pengangguran di Banen paling banyak disumbang oleh lulusan SMK yang sistem pembelajarannya dan orientasinya adalah penempatan kerja. "Ini paradoks juga, karena disayangkan lulusan SMK nggak bisa kerja,"pungkasnya. Berdasarkan survei BPS dari 5,56 juta angkatan kerja di Banten, sebanyak 8,11% di antaranya adalah pengangguran. Jumlah tersebut setara 490,8 ribu orang atau tertinggi se-Indonesia. Pengangguran di Banten juga didominasi oleh lulusan SMK dibandingkan jenjang pendidikan lain. Ada sekitar 13,03 persen pengangguran disumbangkan lulusan SMK. Simak Video "Tak Cuma Polisi, Warga Juga Berkerumun di TKP Penusukan Wiranto"[Gambas:Video 20detik](bri/hns)

Unemployment in Banten the Highest in Indonesia, DPRD: Shocked Too!
05 Nov 2019, 11:03 by Bahtiar Rifa'i


Illustration of job seeker / Photo: Puti Aini Yasmin

Serang - Chairman of the Banten DPRD Commission V Muhammad Nizar said there was a paradox related to the highest unemployment rate in the region of 8.11%. In fact, in Banten there are approximately 16 thousand industries ranging from Tangerang to Serang. "This is paradoxical for us because the number of formal sector industries is almost 16 thousand. So something is wrong," Nizar said while talking to AFP in Serang, Banten, Tuesday (11/05/2019). Even though two weeks ago Commission V had held a hearing with the Manpower Office (Banten Manpower Office). The DPRD received a report that there was a decrease in unemployment and Banten was ranked fifth. For this problem, he will summon Disnaker and UPT Disnaker in the regions. Because, there are UPT tasks which supervise in each industry. He continued to call for clarification whether workers in the Banten industry could not absorb local youth. Including whether brokering occurs in an industry that has often been heard by the public. "The supervision UPT is not only a matter of administration, if the supervision function in the industry runs, I don't think there will be any brokers," he added. Finally, Nizar explained that there needs to be coordination between the Manpower Office and the Education Office especially for the placement of vocational graduates. Moreover, unemployment in Banen is mostly contributed by SMK graduates whose learning system and orientation is work placement. "This is also a paradox, because it is unfortunate that SMK graduates cannot work," he concluded. Based on a BPS survey of 5.56 million workforce in Banten, as many as 8.11% of them are unemployed. The number is equivalent to 490.8 thousand people or the highest in Indonesia. Unemployment in Banten is also dominated by vocational graduates compared to other levels of education. There are around 13.03 percent of unemployment contributed by vocational graduates.
